content:
The Boeing 717 is a twin-engine, single-aisle regional jet aircraft that was originally developed by McDonnell Douglas prior to its acquisition by Boeing in 1997. It has a seating capacity of up to 117 passengers, depending on the configuration chosen by the airline.

Here are some key specifications of the Boeing 717:

* Length: 37.8 meters (124 feet 1 inch)
* Wingspan: 28.5 meters (93 feet 6 inches)
* Height: 8.9 meters (29 feet 2 inches)
* Maximum takeoff weight: 53,800 kilograms (118,500 pounds)
* Range: 2,060 to 3,675 kilometers (1,280 to 2,280 miles)
* Cruise speed: 828 kilometers per hour (515 miles per hour)
* Engines: Two Rolls-Royce BR715 turbofans, each producing 18,500 pounds of thrust

The Boeing 717 has a modern glass cockpit with advanced avionics, including a flight management system, electronic flight instrument displays, and a digital autopilot. It is also known for its fuel efficiency and low noise emissions. The aircraft is typically used for short to medium-haul flights and is popular among regional airlines and low-cost carriers.
